pro_critic_reviews.summary: A hugely enjoyable shambles. It’s a comic deconstruction of that most useless of Hollywood artifacts — the blockbuster sequel — that refuses to take itself seriously on any level, which, face it, is just what we need as the summer boom-boom season shifts into high gear.
“22” merits a B grade. The long final credits, in which Dickson imagines dozens of future scenarios for the undercover boys, kicks it up one notch.
Just think back to everything that was funny in "21 Jump Street." It's exactly the same.

Suffice it to say that it is a cannily-constructed film, and it does have a bigger "movie" feel than the first film. There are places where they swing for some big jokes that don't quite work, but the ambition is dizzying all the way through.
22 Jump Street might not be quite as good as "21 Jump Street," but it's remarkably close, to the point where subsequent viewings could see it elevated above its predecessor.
A great deal of insanity ensues, none of which would work if Tatum and Hill weren't so disarming in their roles. Their level of comfort with the characters and each other helps 22 click.
More is more and is, at times, just right in 22 Jump Street, an exploding piñata of gags, pratfalls, winking asides, throwaway one-liners and self-reflexive waggery.
22 Jump Street is, ultimately, a celebration of the silly and the sweet, a combination that's welcome again and again.
22 Jump Street is a success, as there is a little good ol’ fashioned “heart” beneath its post-modern veneer.
Bigger and better – 22 Jump Street joins the exclusive list of sequels that out-gun their originals. We’re already knocking at the door of no.23.

Rare is the film that understands the pleasures of letting an enraged Ice Cube take out his wrath on an all-you-can-eat buffet. And which other blockbuster in 2014 would interrupt its climactic car chase to lob in a gag about Benny Hill?
It certainly provides that rarest of things: relaxing enjoyment. In all its uncompromising goofiness, 22 Jump Street brings onstream a sugar-rush of entertainment.
This excellent film is a sequel and knows it, and wants us to know that it knows it.

22 Jump Street is hugely successful in retaining - and in many instances, improving upon - the qualities of it predecessor and pitching some jokes that will still have people chuckling for days afterwards.

A few of the self-referential gags get recycled one too many times, but an exuberant buoyancy — and the belly-laugh-a-minute pacing of the jokes — makes 22 Jump Street a hilarious highpoint of an already quite funny summer season.
It's laugh-packed, self-aware in a manner that lets everyone in on the joke, and goofily satisfying in the action department.
22 Jump Street hits far more often than it misses, and even when it misses by a mile, the effort is so delightfully zany that it’s hard not to give Lord and Miller an “A” for effort.
Filmmakers Phil Lord and Chris Miller (who are themselves impressive partners at this point) know enough not to mess with a successful formula.
It's a self-aware movie that makes fun of the macho clichés it indulges.

This is a sequel that wears its well-worn formula, mocking inside jokes and gleeful taste for overkill proudly, flying the high-lowbrow flag for audiences that like their comedy just smart enough to be not-too-dumb.
The car chases are unremarkable, but the stunts — which comically juxtapose Tatum's athletic grace and Hill's stocky clumsiness — are a hoot.
Thanks to this team of merry pranksters, 22 Jump Street hurts so good.
22 Jump Street is exactly what comedy is today. It's coarse, free-flowing and playful.
The sharp writing and tag-team antics lift 22 Jump Street to a high level.
The movie wouldn’t work, of course, without the chemistry between Hill and Tatum, an unlikely duo who share a tremendous charisma.
Be sure to hang around for the closing credits, which imagine all sorts of "Jump Street" sequels to come.

22 Jump Street is a mixed bag of clever spoofery and miscalculated outrageousness. The unveiled homoeroticism of practically all interaction between Jenko and Schmidt is amusing to the point when it isn't.
A comedy about sequels. Like its predecessor, the movie continually teeters on the edge of breaking through the fourth wall.
There are certainly a lot of actors who can match Hill and Tatum as comic actors, but it’s the oddball connection between these two that makes for a very entertaining couple of hours at the movies.
This comedy produces the biggest, loudest laughs of any movie this summer.
22 Jump Street is hardly fresh, but the picture has enough energy to get by.
The best comic turns are by the Afro-Asian twins Keith and Kenny Lucas, whose timing is eerie and superb.
The repetitions are meant as a sort of metajoke, and it works well enough, more often than not, though heightened levels of raunch and chaos seem not so much meta as frantic.
22 Jump Street squeezes every last drop of comic inspiration it can get from Tatum and Hill, as well as the very notion of a sequel to such a superfluous enterprise.

22 Jump Street isn't uncharitable or mean-spirited; at worst, it's just confused. Tatum is, predictably, adorable. His Jenko is a pumped-up naïf bumbling through life with a crooked smile, and Hill again makes a great sparring partner.

To cover up the script's lack of originality, screenwriters Michael Bacall, Oren Uziel, and Rodney Rothman pummel us with a string of self-aware meta-commentary jokes that poke fun at bloated sequels.
There are times when 22 Jump Street is borderline brilliant. Unfortunately, those instances are outnumbered by segments that don't work for one reason or another.

22 Jump Street's scattershot approach to comedy is rooted in the belief that for every anatomical, scatalogical, sexual, or pop-cultural reference and pun gone awry, another will stick to the wall like, um, bodily fluid.
Here's the crazy thing, though. Against all odds, it works.

At its best, 22 Jump Street is less an action comedy than a loosely plotted revue, and though it’s not as witty as either Joe Dante’s "Gremlins 2: The New Batch" or Edgar Wright’s "Hot Fuzz" (in which the directors evinced genuine love for their chosen genres), it’s sure as hell better than a straight buddy-cop sequel.
22 Jump Street is the good-natured, sloppily rendered pile of balderdash for that moment, a movie that’s immune to all criticism and not worth bothering to dislike.
The laughs are what keep the film together, even when the conceit feels been-there-done-that.

22 Jump Street knows how to play to its strengths: Tatum’s performance here is even more puppy-dog lovable than last time, and his scenes with Hill possess a goofy, low-key warmth too often lacking in big-budget comedy.
An unusually fun and funny film.
What’s the difference between “21 Jump Street” and 22 Jump Street? Same as the difference between getting a 21 and a 22 at blackjack.

As funny and batshit insane as the movie often is, the fact that 22 Jump Street knows it's a tiresome sequel doesn't save it from being a tiresome sequel, even as Lord and Miller struggle to conceal the bitter pill of convention in the sweet tapioca pudding of wall-to-wall jokes.

user_reviews.text: Very impressive action the comedy is used just right the story was well written adding elements that made the 1st so great as well as adding new elements to make this one a one of few sequels that steps up to the mark and be better than the original

Undercover agents Jonah Hill & Channing Tatum have graduated to college for their latest assignment, which unfolds a lot like last time (as they're quick to point out in one of many inside jokes). They also mine lots of comedy from the bromance aspects of their partnership. Tatum is even more hilarious with his thick-headed dumbness. Toss in some enjoyable supporting characters and fun action sequences. It rarely happens, but it seemed like this was better than the original. It's a genuinely funny movie. NOTE: The final bit after the credits is worth staying for.

the story of 2 guys going back to college. this is pretty similar to the first movie which is meant to be done. the comedy is really funny and i would put it in my top  ten movies. the struggle of these two friends is moving with allot of great humour. this was better than the first movie which made me want to hang myself. it's a great improvement. (with credits that are worth watching!!!!!)
I loved the hell out of this movie. Its fun and self-relevant and everything that made the first film so great. Pretty much all that needs to be said.
This movie is funny! 22 jump street is one of those buddy cop movies that just makes you laugh all the way through. This is filled with jokes that sometimes works and the bros are pretty stupid.

Did we see the same movie?  I love pretty much enjoy anything Jonah Hill is in. Even early highlights from his career like his short appearance in 40 Year Old Virgin or his amazing 13 hours of **** sucking in Grandma's Boy to his Oscar nominated roles in Moneyball and Wolf of Wall Street are impressive. Besides a small handful of jokes that actually work, Hill not funny in 22 Jump Street, nor is Tanning Chatum. What a shame, I was hopeful it would be good. It's really bad. Skip this, for real!

all i can say about this movie: the most hilarious comedy of the year! i really liked "21 Jump Street". it caught me by surprise, cause it was hilarious and awesome! but "22 Jump Street" is even better. in this movie, Schmidt and Jenko go undercover in college to stop a new drug ring for happening. like i said, this movie was hilarious, and it's even better cause it addresses it. first of all, Jonah Hill and Channing Tatum. these 2 dudes are the best! they got perfect chemistry with each other. and i really loved what they did to their characters in this movie, like it's kinda like a fork-road situation where they're like "Are we really what we want?" also, Ice Cube's in the movie, and he's awesome and hysterical too. there's this one scene where Ice Cube just melts down and i was like "it would've been even better if this guy could rage and melt down on almost everything". also, this movie has the best and funniest end credits ever! not only was the whole movie hilarious, but thanks to the end credits, it's comedy gold! the end credits are hysterical! i was laughing so much, i was like crying. and whenever a sequel pulls that off, that's a win. my main gripe with "22 Jump Street" is that it felt like it had a lotta plot points that were the same with this first movie. that kinda pulled me outta the movie a little bit, i was like "What? Really?" it kinda felt like it was rehashing the first movie a little bit. but all that aside, like i said: "22 Jump Street" is the most hysterical buddy-cop comedy we got so far this year. and i'll be damned if this wasn't better than the first movie, cause yea it was better and funnier. (with the most hysterical end credits ever!)

Don't worry about a complicated plot line, good story, something to think about or worry that you might miss a good movie. 22 Jumpstreet is just a formula written scream loud and there is your punchline type of movie. Its a movie where a little kid said this is getting boring they just keep doing the same lame comedy over and over. Oh kid you are so right! To put it simply, 22 Jumpstreet SUCKS!

This movie was horrible! I got up and walked out after about 45 minutes. This is what I call your Hollywood generic movie. No originality about it! I think I've seen the same movie at least 15 times with other actors and different locations but same movie that was not funny! If you want to see a good movie that I cannot believe has not made any money but DAMN GOOD and that would be Edge of Tomorrow with Tom Cruise and Emily Blunt. Now that was a good movie. Original, funny, and awesome!

much crappier version of the first one.   needed to be edited down.  many jokes repeated way too often.  Really a shame, they got great chemistry.  not really sure how this one is rated higher on MC than the first.

Honestly, I was so surprised with how good it was because i knew it was going to be funny but not as funny as that I have not seen a better comedy like that in..god knows how long. The movie was funny, exciting and the best part was the twists and turns in the movie i mean the movie itself is the same case from 21 jump street so you would think its funny but not as good as the first one. Also many comedies do make a sequel if they are successful such as anchorman, Bruce almighty etc and they aren't as good as the first one but 22 jump street..oh no it was fantastic so far out of seeing the biggest movies this year X men, Godzilla, Spider man etc also being a Die hard marvel fan this movie was the best i've seen this year i haven't laughed this much at a comedy and i have not witnessed a audience laugh as much also. I don't want to explain the plot because you just need to see it seriously this weekend go and see it and you will get what im on about.

honestly, I was so surprised with how good it was because i knew it was going to be funny but not as funny as that I have not seen a better comedy like that in..god knows how long. The movie was funny, exciting and the best part was the twists and turns in the movie i mean the movie itself is the same case from 21 jump street so you would think its funny but not as good as the first one. Also many comedies do make a sequel if they are successful such as anchorman, Bruce almighty etc and they aren't as good as the first one but 22 jump street..oh no it was fantastic so far out of seeing the biggest movies this year X men, Godzilla, Spider man etc also being a Die hard marvel fan this movie was the best i've seen this year i haven't laughed this much at a comedy and i have not witnessed a audience laugh as much also. I don't want to explain the plot because you just need to see it seriously this weekend go and see it and you will get what im on about. W_D2014 is my second acc didn't know how to delete a review so i re uploaded it

It's not terrible in any way but really not that good. It's really subpar and disappointing from the much superior predecessor. The movie plays out the same movie and is really a reply of the first one. It has moments where it's hilarious, but then runs with gags that aren't very funny. When I say runs with them, I mean ten minutes of the same gag that just isn't funny. It reminds me of this is the end. I'm giving it the same score for a reason. The jokes are funny at parts but other gags are just god awful. This is the end has moments where it's ten times funnier than anything in 22 jump street, but the quantity of gags is more in this one. Overall I should have seen HTTYD. 6.5

The first movie is much much funnier. There were a few big laughs that were very solid. I found that the final 20 minutes wasn't funny at all and dragged quite a bit. The constant under the cuff gay humor is hilarious in the first 30 minutes of the movie but when they start recycling the same joke over and over and over again it gets tiring. The big laughs are few and the slight chuckles are plenty. Average movie at best.

I was pleasantly surprised with how funny this movie was. It was even more entertaining than 21 Jump Street (the reboot), which I really enjoyed. A *fantastic* movie to go see with a few friends! Very well directed, acted, and produced. While most Summer Movies usually are CGI garbage (*AHEM* Amazing Spiderman 2, Michael Bay movies...) '22 Jump Street' was a quality summer flick (other new quality movies worth noting are 'X-Men: Days of Future Past' and 'Edge of Tomorrow'). HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.

Exactly the same as the first movie.  They even say that in the movie a handful of times.  22 Jump Street is a meta-movie to the most extreme, and if you did not enjoy the first film you probably will not like this one.
22 Jump Street is exactly and actually better than the original 21 Jump Street. The characters are great, the story is good and the joke are pretty funny.

22 Jump Street is a "modern" comedy. Its got its male gay stuff, male oral sex, rambling plot, "generic" Black stereo types, "f" bombs going off like you are in Afganistan, which would be funnier by the way, brain numbing stupidity, and an annoying sense of "why did I waste my money on this film."

I went in with an open mind to this sequel...I was wrong about this movie. It had very few funny moments,  but other than those few "moments" is just another movie for the brainless zombies of the max to watch.

This movie absolutely sucked.  Poor script, dumb plot, weak acting.  Not funny at all.  I've seen a lot of cop buddy movies and this one stands out as being one of the worst.  Slap stick can be funny but this sure isn't.  Ice Cube carried what little this sorry movie had to offer and his part was far too little.  Whatever team wrote this script should be fired.  The director should be embarrassed to death having his name attached.  Save your money

I'm going to probably have to see it again. I didn't really find it that funny and was pretty bored throughout, but I was in a bad mood going in and I think that contributed to it. Update after second viewing coming soon.

Entertaining sequel to 21 Jump Street knew that it is derivative..so it made fun of it. Still, while it rehashes a lot from the original, it's seeing both leads really going for it that made this franchise a hoot. Some of their jokes don't work but those that do are so good, you'll be laughing until you cry.

This was a very funny movie. Tatum and Hill have excellent chemistry again, with some funny performances by supporting characters. This might be the first time I liked a comedy sequel more than the first.

It was a really funny movie, but as you may expect not as funny as the first one, buy that didn't stop me to laugh at least of 60% of the jokes, which is very good percentage. Without  spoiling anything, for the the most funny moments of the film is that the movie is really self aware of who they are and how Hollywood likes to milk every single thing that is successful (plus Ice Cube is really hilarious, oh man those texts messages). It is a nice summer movie, the only thing it can stop of enjoying this movie is the other people at the theatre who laugh harder than the dialogue of the movie...anyway...pretty good movie, if you enjoyed the first one, this one is a must, if you didn't like the first one, don't approach this one, the formula hasn't change. BTW wait for the credits for future possible sequels =)

With wit and self-mockery, 22 Jump Street brings bromance, satirical action scene and a good dose of laughter. It succeeds in avoiding redundancy of a sequel, which the movie itself points out, and brings enjoyable foolhardy yet sufficiently clever humor. Jonah Hill and Channing Tatum is a great couple, half of the jokes are on their expenses. Plenty of romance analogy delivered in staggeringly serious way, while the rest of it is over-the-top comedy. Script is smart, bordering on improvised banter, and it neatly pokes on popular culture.

If it ain't broke don't fix it or whatever the saying is. This movie is just like the first one but guess what? The first movie was good and since this is basically the same concept it is also just as good if not better. The jokes and humor in this movie is just as good as it was in the first one. The acting and story were great as well as the action scenes. Channing tatum had the best performance especially one part in the movie that had me laughing so hard. So if you liked the first movie joy will enjoy this one. This series hasn't lost its steam it's just getting starting and if the credits are anything to judge by jump street has alot more in store for us in the future 9/10
"We shoot dicks off here at jump street"

I think many reviewers are blindsided by the fact that this movie is sequel to a pretty good comedy. But 22 Jump Street is not a good movie, it's a great movie. Yes, the underlying plot is the same as 21 Jump Street, but the comedic tone is far more sure-footed, masterfully playing with the idea of a sequel. Not only are Channing Tatum and Jonah Hill at the top of their game, but the supporting cast is brilliant, and each gets an opportunity to shine, especially Jillian Bell whose performance alone is worth the price of admission. Not every gag is a home run, some are just doubles or triples, but there are no strikeouts and a few, like Ice Cube's tantrum, Hill's fist fight and the credits, are World Series worthy. Destined for the comedy hall of fame.

Not as funny as the first one but still well done. Ice Cube has a better and funnier role in this one than the last one and two of the funniest scenes in the movie involve him. Tatum and Hill are both great in this and still have god chemistry together.  Seen this movie twice now and even during the second viewing I still laughed a lot.

A film that really builds on the characters from the first film. The brotherly bond between Hill and Tatum is enforced greatly with this film, which is made all the better with jokes that kept me laughing (howling, even) throughout every other scene. Some of the end credits gags had me laughing harder than I have in a long time.
The only way I can judge a comedy is by how hard it makes me laugh.  And this film made me laugh hard.  And Wyatt Russell was the biggest surprise.  Kurt Russell's kid is hilarious.

It's often stated that sequels never live up to the original; that doesn't necessarily apply to this one. In fact, in terms of plot, there is hardly a difference between the two. The plot is simple–the two hilarious undercover cops head back to collage to find and stop a drug ring that has surfaced at the school. One thing that really stood out to me was how self-aware this film was, almost so much so, it becomes annoying. For example, it constantly referenced how sequels never live up to the first one, and how the plot between the two was the same. Something that bothers me in the genre of comedy lately, is the stress factored into a film that is supposed to be relaxing to viewers and hold some good laughs. 22 Jump Street handled this really well, as it had some very funny scenes while some were exaggerated, over-the-top. The movie seemed to reuse jokes and cliché ideas that were not very entertaining. Don’t get me wrong, 22 Jump Street is still hilarious, but expect the same kind of comedy as in the original. The chemistry between the two leads is great and carries the whole movie pretty well. I felt like the run time was a bit long and could have been condensed to make a better movie. The pacing was a little off, almost awkward at times, where dead-time could have been filled with more laughs or simply left on the cutting room floor; this detracted from the overall film. Unrealistic scenarious seemed to overwhelm the comedic aspect quite a bit. I have to say, I laughed my butt off.  Even though it wasn't the most creative comedy, it was simple, didn't require much thinking and let me just sit back and laugh. If you do see this movie stay for the end credits because they’re a knee-slapper.
This is a second sequel to "21 Jump Street". It is comedy and quite a funny one too.
The movie was really awesome. I actually am suggesting to see it. Though, from the middle part made me not laugh there. The beginning and end part made me laugh to the floor.

Funny, satirical, and tongue-in-cheek, 22 Jump Street not only delivers consistent laughs, but hilariously parodies its genre with great performances and interesting action sequences, with the funniest credits I've ever seen.

It's way too similar to the first movie, which is lazy and therefore its inferior! But nonetheless 22 Jump Street is funny comedy with some hilarious moments! PS - Jonah Hill carried the entire movie (again)

A squeal that we never needed,  feels more like a paint job to the previous. Its a solid movie that can never really lift the bar. Would i recommend watching? You'r better off waiting to rent this movie. I call average, however there are a collection of laughs to be found.

Everything works in 22 Jump Street, the chemistry of the leads, how the humor is presented, the sincere parts and how it doesn't take itself seriously. 22 Jump Street isn't just the best comedy of the year, it's also one of the best films of the year so far.

This is THE MOST hilarious and best comedy I've ever watched. Its much better than the first one although I also enjoyed the first one too. I really hope the sequels comes out as they hinted on the credits. I'm not sure if that's going to be true but if it is, I'll be hoping for it. Seriously super hilarious. Those who don't find it funny might not have a sense of humor.
"22 Jump Street" 10 Scale Rating: 8.0 (Great) ...
As good as the first one with many great nods to the fact that this is indeed a sequel.  There are many similarities between the first and this one with a few twists that for the most part work.  B+

ok well i watched this movie in theaters and all i can say is that you must see this movie it's the funniest movie i have seen this year 'screw neighbors ' this is a comedy gem one of the funniest sequels of all time here's a little background the boys are back only this time they must go to college a k a 22 jump street and catch a drug bust within the college it's the fall down funniest comedy of the year u would be a fool to miss i say see it

It pokes fun at how sequels often lose the magic of the original, however that doesn't save it from falling into many of the same pitfalls. Certain gags try too hard and yes the plot is basically the same (the latter isn't really a bad thing). You can tell the film is happily aware of this and embraces it fully. Some of the best, understated jokes come from this knowledge. This meta-comedy does keep things afloat, but it doesn't turn into a laugh riot until the movie starts doing its own thing.

Not as consistently funny as the original, but definitely had the biggest laughs of the two. Channing Tatum and Ice Cube steal the show, while Jonah Hill comes off as less memorable. Not only is this movie hilarious, but it's also clever with its character dynamics between Tatum and Hill. They are so different in every way, but their bond make them inseparable. This is put on display perfectly when we meet their dorm room neighbor twins, but it's what makes them so lovable. Watching them share screen time together is a treat for everyone. I enjoyed this movie just as much as the first, and I recommend this movie to anyone that isn't offended by foul language and sexual jokes.
Even though its self-referentiality may become tiring to a point, "22 Jump Street" still hauls the gut-busting laughs and poignant glances at friendship in at a solid and enjoyable rate.

The first half of 22 Jump Street is fresh and laugh-out-loud hilarious. But then movie resorts to clichés and becomes repetitive in the second half. But all in all, it is a silly, self-referential riot that is a great way to kick off the summer.

I thought 21 Jump Street was hilarious, and so I went into this movie with a lot of expectations, and for the part, 22 Jump Street met them.  It was funny in a similar, yet different kind of way than 21 Jump Street was, and didn't suffer from a lot of the repetitiveness or tired jokes that plague other sequels.

Let's clear this up at the start, this movie has no plot. Its basically every awkward situation you'll ever have, but done with Hill and Tatum so you can still laugh. Which is what the movie is good at. It doesn't try to make you chuckle, it builds the situation through a painfully boring story to a side clenching laugh that'll have you. Honking for air and clapping like a retarded seal for a minute straight. Those moments make this movie worth it.

22 Jump Street took my by surprise, because it is as good as 21 Jump Street. The chemistry between the actors is so effective and sometimes heartwarming, most of the movie is a laugh out loud fest, and it is not overfilled with raunchiness and crudeness, it is surprisingly heartwarming despite using the same formula used in its predecessor. Jenko & Schmidt are undercover cops, who after the success of busting out drug dealers in High School, they are out looking to bust drug dealers in college, it is obviously the same. But it is all about how they handle the movie or under handle the movie, in this case the sequel is as good as the first if not carrying some scenes more effectively, for ex: the action sequences which are tense. Jonah Hill & Channing Tatum are really great in the movie, Ice Cube is hilarious in this movie, the best part so far, and the end sequence is actually really funny and very creative. 22 Jump Street is as good and hilarious as the first film, at some parts better but formulaic and copies off the first, "for goodness sakes I saw the twist coming!" but it is still a fun and over the top, if you liked the first one you will also appreciate this one, it is the perfect movie for the weekend.
A must see, Very funny and clever.
Definitely much better than I thought it was going to be, not a hangover 2 situation, but most certainly not as good as the first

To say there are similarities between 21 Jump Street and 22 Jump Street would be the understatement of the century. These movies are more or less identical. The characters, themes, and stories between the two movies are more or less the exact same, the only major difference being that one takes places in high school and the other in college.
Prior to watching this: I have not seen 21 Jump Street (film and TV series).

This film was undeniably funny and arguably better than its predecessor, which I must say is somewhat impressive, considering it's not quite as raunchy as the first. The jokes and crazy gags in this film are what really hit home with me. The film's self-aware attitude, much like in the first film, was really fun to watch. The bromance between Jonah Hill and Channing Tatum also worked nicely once again. The plotline pretty much feels the same from the first film, the only difference being that they're in college instead of high school this time. However, the film still manages to come up with great and honest new laughs that make up for that. Overall, if you loved or even just enjoyed the first film, this one will likely please you. Also, stick around for a funny end-credit sequence as well as one last brief scene at the very end of the credits.

A torrid weekend, the best recreation is a cinema getaway in the local multiplex, the options are paltry, having no slightest interest in the fourth TRANSFORMERS juggernaut, I have to choose between two sequels, HOW TO TRAIN YOUR DRAGON 2 or this one, it is a tough choice, I enjoyed HOW TO TRAIN YOUR DRAGON (2010, 8/10) thoroughly, but due to a recent impassivity towards animations, eventually I opt for the latter albeit I have yet watched its predecessor, a Hollywood comedy might be the elixir to quench the summer lethargy.
It is easy to assume that all comedy sequels are straight out terrible but 22 Jump Street is successful for the most part.
Surely one of the most enjoyable comedies this year. The chemistry between the two main characters creates a brilliant relationship. Ice Cube and his rage scene also adds to the comedy in this movie.

For a movie that was practically the same movie as the last movie, i thought it was actually good! Mainly due to the jokes in it being fairly original and having the movie make fun of the fact that it was the same movie is always lots of fun. There were points of the movie where i was actually laughing really hard, and that's all i really ask from a comedy. The only downside i would say from this movie is that it's alot of college humor, which might disclude some of the audience depending on their view towards college.
Short on laughs, but smartly written and effectively explores its protagonists undeniable chemistry, 22 Jump Street is a slight improvement on its slightly amusing predecessor.
I was expecting good.  I wasn't expecting this good! I can't believe I'm saying it but I actually liked it better than the first, and that's definitely saying something.

"Hilliaraballs"!!!! So many different funny parts of this movie that just get better and better, both movies in the franchise are great in there own way but if you liked the first one, your going to love this one too!!

How many sequels have been accused of basically repackaging the last film we saw and charging us the price of a cinema ticket once again? That’s Hollywood, but at least Phil Lord & Christopher Miller, the directorial duo behind the first 21 Jump Street and the seminal The Lego Movie (which also came out this year – these guys have been busy), are acutely aware of this and unafraid of letting us know that they know.

Not much to say regarding this movie. It's a comedy movie and a very funny one at that. The first film (21 Jump Street) was definitely stronger as a comedy film however this doesn't leave you disappointed either. Bits of left-leaning propaganda (like every comedy movie) incorporated into the movie which might turn off some audiences who don't share likewise opinions. However it is definitely a funny movie and Jonah Hill/Channing Tatum give a comedic duo performance as good as the Belushi/Akroyd films from the 70s/80s. It's a fun movie to watch with a night out with your friends/girlfriend.

This if by far the funniest film of the year. From the jokes to the acting to the subtle nuances. This entire film was nothing short of amazing. Being better than the first one Phil Lord and Chris Miller have certainly out done themselves this year. A must see!

Channing Tatum, and Jonah Hill..such an odd ball pairing in every way shape or form. A buff macho, and dull headedness, mixed with a brainy, textual and lame counterpart. Who would think this pairing could, and most importantly, should work. Their names; Chris Lord and Phil Lord, the creative duo behind the fresh and lively revival of the series that made Johnny Depp famous.

I saw this several weeks of hype, and maybe had too high expectations, so I was severely disappointed.  I only started laughing about 45 minutes in the movie, and afterwards, my laughter died down to a couple of chuckles.  I think they took the audience for granted.  On the plus side, I still have a lot of respect for the first movie, but I would skip this one, or at least catch it on video.

One of the funniest movies this year. Fans from the first part will also like the 2. one, it's the same stupid but insanely funny humor. I thought that the film will be funny but my expectations were exceeded. I often had to laugh out loud during the movie, but i wasn't the only one the whole cinema was laughing.

The chemistry between Tatum and Hill is as marvellous as in the prequel. One might actually call it the best romantic comedy of this summer ´14. Ice Cube is doing a really entertaining job but the lusterless villains keep dropping way too many bad jokes towards the ending of the movie. (Yeah, we accepted that Jonah Hill is "old" the first time it was mentioned... but then...come on).

22 Jump Street was sort of campy (as for the acting), and the story was basically the same story as the first one (I bet the writers used the same screenplay, only changing the name of the drug and high school to college). It had it's moments, as for the comedy, but it was not at all as good as the first movie.
Probably the most hilarious comedy this year. If you enjoy Jonah Hill this is a must-see. The movie has a lot of action and remember able quotes. It gives laughs beginning to end.

This movie was so funny that I watched it twice in cinema. Usually sequels tend to be worse than the original but this is the exception to the stereotype. Ice Cube's character was so funny that one of my friends nearly spilled his drink in laughter. I hope there is 23 Jump Street because if there isn't, I'm gonna be angry.

"22 Jump Street" is a very funny film and a great sequel to "21 Jump Street". It always had me laughing, and this movie had everything going against it, but it somehow works. The movie is pretty light-hearted, thankfully, because I've had enough of comedies like "A Haunted House" that aim to offend. The biggest flaw this movie had was that some of the running gags got a little old towards the end, but "22 Jump Street" is still a very funny and enjoyable movie.

"22 Jump Street" is definitely one of the better movies of 2014 considering the fact that this year has been a pretty bad movie year. Τhis movie is entertaining and it's just a very pleasant and fun one to watch. Nice chemistry between the two which made for a very good movie overall.

The whole script is self aware enough that never let the predictably horrible plot get in the way of many great gags. This move is about the gags, and they provide the entertainment in what is a very funny movie. And they really came through with an actually funny, 3rd act action scene. That said, a love of dumb guy humor is prerequisite to enjoying this movie.

While it may not be as good as the first one 22 Jump Street is still a good movie. A lot of the humor works and a fair amount of the film feels fresh. With all that said the film isn’t a masterpiece either. The humor feels a bit more eager/desperate to please this time around, the film is more frantic with pacing, and despite all its jokes about unoriginal sequels this film does have a fair amount of rehashing. But the main reason why this film isn’t as good as the first one is it lacks the heart the first one did. All heartfelt moments feel forced and generic and the chemistry between Hill and Tatum isn’t quite as strong as it was in the first film being more mean-spirited this time involving a somewhat generic argument cliché. Despite all those issues though I enjoyed the film. The saving grace of this film is that most of the jokes work really well preventing it from being a letdown and somewhat disguising the fact that this is a cashgrab. Its miles ahead of the Hangover sequels and is not the disappointment I thought it would be. If you are a fan of the first one definitely check it out as you’ll probably enjoy it just don’t expect a great sequel. If you didn’t like the first one this one won’t do anything to change your mind.  For a film that didn’t needed to exist, and was probably ordered by Hollywood, Chris Miller and Phil Lord stepped up to the plate to deliver a film that may not blow you away or have the same lasting appeal as the first one but is still enjoyable and provides a lot of laughs. To the guys who made the Hangover sequels, take notes this is how you do a good comedy sequel.

I got tricked: I watched the trailer for it a long time ago, and for some reason I got 22 Jump Street confused with something else, obviously, and I remembered it was supposed to be good. So I started watching it without preoccupations. But, after about twenty seconds, I realised it wasn't what I thought it would be.
Best comedy film of 2014 by far. Very hilarious and full of suspense. You can really appreciate Channing Tatum and Jonah Hill duo. The story line is full of surprise and it's always funny.
Oh wow. I expect a funny movie sequel but damn, I didn’t expect a very funny sequel with a lot of heart in it.

After making their way through high school (twice), big changes are in store for officers Schmidt (Jonah Hill) and Jenko (Channing Tatum) when they go deep undercover at a local college. But when Jenko meets a kindred spirit on the football team, and Schmidt infiltrates the bohemian art major scene, they begin to question their partnership. Now they don't have to just crack the case - they have to figure out if they can have a mature relationship. If these two overgrown adolescents can grow from freshmen into real men, college might be the best thing that ever happened to them.
even do is a generic comedy movie is a really fun movie and great sequel to 21 jump street being a best movie in a lot of aspects, but is nothing majestic either is just a really funny movie

This movie surprised me when I saw it in theaters, I thought it would have a few good jokes and be the typical cheesy squeal. But it does better then that, I found myself laughing out loud consistently. The movie is every self aware, they never break the forth wall but if you listen to the dialog you can tell when they are poking fun at the movie it self. Jonah Hill and Channing Tatum do a great job together again, seeing the improv lines they do adds a nice touch.22 Jump Street is also directed by Phil Lord and Christopher Miller, the guys who made The Lego Movie/21 Jump Street. The story doesn't have much to it, but it's not the reason you are watching the film. It's nice to see that they know the movie they are making is ridiculous and they take every chance they get to take a jab at the movie.

22 Jump Street does what every sequel hopes to, take the success of the original film and make something even better. The film plays off the fact that it's an unoriginal sequel giving it an unusual originality. The chemistry between Jonah Hill and Channing Tatum allows for beautiful comedic timing with some amazing one-liners and fantastic tear-worthy scenes.

22 Jump Street is a great comedy film. To me it is better than the first one. I like how the movie is longer than 21 Jump Street because most of the time it means more laughs. And it applies this time for sure. The scene during the credits is probably another reason why I love it. If you want a good and very fun comedy 22 Jump Street is worth your time.
It was unusual that 22 Jump Street was better than it's predecessor. A sequel is usually NEVER better than it's predecessor, yet this was story wise, and comedy wise.

In ways funnier than 21 Jump Street though I still liked 21 more just because of how much it surprised me. But 22 Jump Street is a consistently hilarious comedy, Jonah Hill and Channing Tatum are the best buddy cop combo in years.

Tatort Klassenzimmer mit Johnny Depp war super, 21 Jump Street  hat mich enttäuscht, weil der Film einfach oberflächlich und pubertär ist. Was nun 22 Jump Street sollte, ist mir ein völliges Rätsel, denn die Story ist mit dem ersten Film fast identisch und die Darsteller liefern nichts Neues und auch nichts Besseres. Was einen Johnny Depp zur Kinolegende machte, wirkt bei Hill und Tatum nur aufgesetzt und peinlich. Es ist ein Film, den es einfach nicht geben sollte!

All i can say is that you are all dumb.   22 jump street was horrible with maybe one or two funny lines in it.  the rest of the movie was awkward and hard to watch.  LETS BE SERIOUS!    the first one was way better than the second because the second one BLOWS...  NIKOZGURI1997    YOUR AN IDIOT!

Falls so short of what made '21 Jump Street' funny.  This movie spent too much time trying to make fun of itself  that it ended up really not being funny.  It does have one or two scenes that I can say I actually laughed at, but the rest of the movie is the characters actually telling the audience (yes, breaking the wall several times) that what they are watching is nothing new and really the same thing, if not less, as the first.  There is even a segment where they poke fun at the budget of the actual movie and how they went over it so the special effects and everything had to be kept to a minimum.  This film tried way to hard to be a satire comedy of itself and it failed.  I admit that I loved '21 Jump Street' but this sequel comes nowhere close to it.

A lot of the same gags but with slightly different twists to them in this next installment of the Jump Street series. Not to say that there aren't some new things thrown in there. This is a very funny movie, but it definitely has some moments where they were forcing jokes.  Tatum and Hill continue to be a winning formula in my opinion. This movie is entertaining and enjoyable and I would recommend it to anyone who liked 21 Jump Street (heck even the credits are pretty funny too, so definitely stay to watch at least part of it)

A very satisfying sequel despite its parallel plot to the first film, 22 jump street handles the comedy genre extremely well. The script was intelligent although at times several jokes felt forced but all the more Jonah and Tatum's performances payed off and shows confidence within their character's which gives the audience a reason to view this amusing film.

22 Jump Street is Fun.It's an hilarious movie.It gives good laughs and impressive jokes to the audiences.This is a good sequel better than the original movie it has some flaws but it's still worth to watch.
It is not a great comedy, but like 21, this sequel has witty, non-stop dialouge, brains, and heart, which is alot for a comedy to achieve, even more so than the first.

22 Jump Street is essentially the exact same movie as the first film in this newly rebooted franchise. Why does that not matter all that much? Because in this laugh-filled comedy, they actually mock that fact multiple times where they tear down the 4th wall and don't even care. Sure, I felt that they overdid it a bit with this, as well as the exaggerated homosexual innuendos, but the good still far outweighed the bad. Like the last film, the sequences were outrageous but funny and the acting was just dude-bro enough to be spot on for what they were going for. Expanding Ice Cube's role was also a smart idea, as was the casting of the stunning Amber Stevens. It astounds me that she hasn't had more success in her acting career. Overall though, if you enjoyed the first one, you'll like this movie too because 22 Jump Street is essentially the exact same movie as the first film in this newly rebooted franchise... see what I did there?

With solid acting and a quite ludicrous plot, and as so few movies are capable of, 22 Jump Street maintains the exact same comedic quality of the first one. One shouldn't expect anything more than this, though.

cant stop laughing one of the funniest movies i have ever seen this movie should get 5star rating you should also see the first part 21 jump strreeeeeeeeeeeeeeetttttttttttttttttt !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!1 hahahhaa

22 Jump Street is by far one of the funniest films of 2014. Don't watch it expecting an amazing story and unexpected plot. This is just an awesome, well done, ridiculous action and comedy film. You will be laughing from the beginning to the end.

The best comedy of 2014 (again, as its predecessor was in 2012). The chemistry between Channing Tatum and Jonah Hill is crazy and the story goes further in their bromance. Truly hilarious how they compare it to a real relationship throughout the film. It is fresh, it is funny, it is sexy. It is basically the same film as Jump Street 21 but not failing at all in its delivery. It is surprising that they managed to make it equally enjoyable. See it!

This was a pretty bad movie overall.  I get that it is meant to be an over the top stupid comedy, but there were far too funny scenes.  The whole bromance comedy was ridiculous, and it was the same old dumb lame punchlines trying to be funny, but badly failing at it.   There were a few parts where I found myself slightly chuckling, but Jonah Hill is so pathetic and bad in this movie.  Channing Tatum was almost as bad, but not quite.    Hopefully this will be the end of this series, and even if there is a 23rd jump street, I won't be watching.
i enjoyed the poetry slam and the bosses daughter jokes....but saying that the girl hes with is less attractive than someone is kinda lame...and so is the rest of the movie if i remember correctly
What can i say about this movie. Is one of the best comedy i ever seen. I think is the best movie of 2014, and is very funnny. ***********************

I was surprised of how hilarious it turned out to be. Like everyone knows how some sequels fail in the big screen. But this one was funnier than the first one. Even though you can tell that Ice Cube seriously tried to be really hilarious which he did but that was just Channing Tatum and Jonah Hills job. Now I can't wait for 23 Jumpstreet.
The amount of "serious" jokes make these films are worth seeing, and although they are a bit repetitive and dumb, still funny. There are good sequels, and "21 jump street" is one of them.

This movie helps give a whole new definition to the term "bro-mance". The cool thing is that this is one of the rare occasions wherein the sequel is just as good as the original. Lots of great laughs here and Jillian Bell is a real standout as the weird roommate of Jonah Hill's love interest.

22 Jump Street is a fantastic sequel that matches up to the surprising quality of the original. The jokes come thick and fast and don't ever seem to end and the characters of Schmidt and Jenko are just as likeable and idiotic as the first movie. Great stuff all around!
Ugh. Probably the most disappointing movie of 2014. I thoroughly enjoyed the first movie. All of my friends said this was great or even better than the first. I was pumped. And I was let down.
Caso especial en el que parece ser que la secuela es mejor que la original, la realidad es que la comedia permanece intacta como en la primera película.

"They're not 21 anymore."  22 Jump Street made me laugh and smile.  This is an entertaining action/comedy movie that never takes itself too seriously, even through the ending credits.  Channing Tatum and Jonah Hill make a great comedy team.  Throw in an always intense Ice Cube and you've got a non-regrettable couple of hours of movie watching.

22 Jump street, makes fun of the sequels by doing the same thing switching the formulas. It's hilarious it's on edge and Tatum and Hill's chemistry is here and they always go that far with their humor. Directors Phil Lord and Christopher Miller  (who are themselves impressive partners at this point), know not to mess with the film's successful formula. Channing Tatum is funny while being thick-headed dumbness. Jonah Hill is even more funny by acting like a child. Grade A
Fantastic follow up to the very surprising performance of the first film. It is still just as funny and fresh as the first. Tattum and Hill have the perfect chemistry and are hilarious.
They really kicked it up a notch with this one. The humor continues to be well done, and even occasionally meta, with a plot that allows for a lot of nice individual scenes that link together well.

Irony of ironies is that almost everything I would like to say was already said in one of the opening scenes. The first movie was surprisingly good, so the second movie does more of the same, just raising the ante a little.
22 Jump Street is keeping the love from the first installment. It's way no longer 20 anymore, not even 21.  It's 22 for your information. Keep the excitement going, fans.

In the grand tradition of comedy follow-ups like Gremlins 2: The New Batch and Airplane II: The Sequel ("Ted, I have the strangest feeling we've been through this exact same thing before"), 22 Jump Street has a giddy time going full meta. The new headquarters of useless policemen Jenko (Channing Tatum) and Schmidt (Jonah Hill) is, as befits a pumped-up, budget-enhanced sequel, far swankier than their original digs, complete with a slick office for Ice Cube's character that resembles an actual ice cube. Meanwhile, an early action sequence suggesting that the franchise is about to blast off in a new direction is quickly put paid to by the heroes' pencil-pushing superior (Nick Offerman). "This department has invested a lot of money to make sure Jump Street keeps going," he chides, shooting down Tatum's suggestion that the duo join the (boom) Secret Service. Instead, they're going back to school — specifically, college — in a case that mirrors, beat-for-beat, the original movie.
Not going to lie, this movie was so funny. Tatum and Hill have so much chemistry and are so good and delivering these lines with perfect comedic timing.

Very impressive action the comedy is used just right the story was well written adding elements that made the 1st so great as well as adding new elements to make this one a one of few sequels that steps up to the mark and be better than the original.

A good sequel, and despite not quite reaching the level of the first film, still a thoroughly entertaining experience. Going to college was a natural progression as a sequel, and although following the same basic structure as the first film, it brought in characters and jokes which drew away from the blatant similarities to the first instalment. The credits scenes were easily the best credits I've seen and certainly worth staying around for!

22 Jump Street is just as good as the original; with amazing casting choices, brilliant direction and writing, and hilarious comedy. Definitely watch it if you haven't already, after the first one of course.

Is it more or less the same plot as the first film? Yes. Does the film know this and use it as a comedic advantage to give us big laughs? Absolutely. 22 Jump Street is even funnier than the first film and Tatum and Hill once again shine as a duo with excellent comedic chemistry.

1. Просто тупая копирка сюжета с первой части, только в этот раз главные герои поменялись местами в некоторых ситуациях, гениально! 2. Вообще не смешно, вроде бы и есть моменты, когда хочешь засмеяться... но не смешно.
